threads.title: Alpha Insights: Weekend Edition
threads.content:
Tweet 1: The biggest companies in the world are telling us exactly where the future is heading.

Here's what we're hearing on earnings calls this quarter 👇🧵

Tweet 2: 🚀 Microsoft: 15M Copilot paid seats (+160% YoY), 90% of Fortune 500 onboard

Salesforce: $900M AI ARR (+120%), 5K+ Agentforce deals, new all-you-can-eat AI licensing

Adobe: 24B+ Firefly generations, $400M direct AI revenue

These aren't experiments. These are product lines printing money.

Tweet 3: 🚀 Palantir: 137% US commercial growth, $7.2B 2026 guide (+61% YoY)

ServiceNow: $15.5B revenue target, CEO gunning for $1T valuation

Shopify: $11.6B revenue (+30%), AI commerce "at full throttle"

The companies deploying AI fastest are pulling away from everyone else.

Tweet 4: 🚀 Every AI app needs a data layer:

• Snowflake: Cortex AI live, growth re-accelerated to 30%+ YoY
• MongoDB: Vector search powering AI apps
• Datadog: LLM monitoring — someone has to watch all these agents
• CrowdStrike: Charlotte AI automating security, stock +51% in 2025

Picks and shovels are winning again.

Tweet 5: 🚀 AI is reshaping industries you wouldn't expect:

• Duolingo: 80%+ AI-generated content
• Intuit: AI tax prep across TurboTax + QuickBooks
• HubSpot: Breeze AI across CRM
• Atlassian: Rovo AI in Jira + Confluence
• Toast: Restaurant automation at scale

Every CEO now has an "AI section" in their earnings call. That IS the signal.

Tweet 6: 🚀 The capital confirms it:

• Anthropic: $30B at $380B valuation
• Waymo: $16B round
• AI = 52.7% of ALL venture capital

The smartest money in the world is making the same bet — and public companies are proving them right every quarter.

Tweet 7: Every earnings call. Same story:

AI adoption → productivity gains → reinvestment → acceleration

The companies leaning in are pulling away. The data is clear.

Biggest enterprise shift since cloud. And we're still early. 🫡
